titleStmt.title: To CHARLES LEVER,Charles James Lever (1806-72; Dictionary of National Biography), novelist. Lived on the Continent from 1845; British Consul at Spezzia in the Gulf of Argolis, Greece. He had been in England, 1864, when CD gave him help over his money problems: Pilgrim Letters 10, p. 466. 26 AUGUST 1865

body.p: The naval officer of gigantic statureSydney Smith Haldimand Dickens (1847-72), CD’s fifth son, about whose small size CD often joked. Served as midshipman on H.M.S. Orlando, 6 Dec 61 to 12 May 64; joined H.M.S. Pelican, June 64. who will (I hope) present this note to you, is my son, bearing a high character in the service. He is naturally desirous to shake hands with a famous writer who is his father’s friend. And I know you will good naturedly gratify him if you can.
